articles.author: Promit Mukherjee, Rod Nickel
articles.description: Canadians go to the polls after an election campaign in which U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs and musings about annexing Canada became the central issue.
articles.title: Canadians vote in election dominated by concerns about Trump

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Spain and Portugal were hit by a widespread power blackout that paralysed public transport, caused large traffic jams and delayed airline flights, and utility operators were scrambling to restore the grid.
articles.title: Large areas of Spain and Portugal hit by massive power blackout

articles.author: Nandita Bose, Ted Hesson
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump plans to sign an executive order on Monday directing the attorney general and the secretary of Homeland Security to identify within a month the cities and states that are not complying with federal immigration laws, a White House official said Monday.
articles.title: Trump to sign order requiring list of sanctuary cities, states, official says

articles.author: Cordelia Hsu, Christine Chen
articles.description: Australian university student Jessica Louise Smith says she will cast her vote in Saturday's general election with only one objective: avoiding the "worst possible" outcome of a right-wing government.
articles.title: Australia's young voters set aside disillusionment to keep out right-wing

articles.author: Fayaz Bukhari
articles.description: The government of India's Jammu and Kashmir territory has decided to shut 48 of the 87 tourist destinations in Kashmir and enhanced security at the remaining ones.
articles.title: India shuts over half of Kashmir tourist spots in security review

articles.author: Daniel Trotta
articles.description: The election eve truck-ramming that killed 11 people and injured dozens more in Vancouver sent waves of grief across Canada's Filipino community, integral to Canada in part through many members' roles as caregivers.
articles.title: Filipino 'caring culture' hit hard by Canada truck-ramming that killed 11

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia said on Monday it was waiting for a signal from Ukraine regarding Kyiv's willingness to hold direct negotiations to end the war, but said it did not so far see any signs of movement.
articles.title: Russia says signal for start of direct peace talks should come from Ukraine

articles.author: Minh Nguyen, Francesco Guarascio
articles.description: As a young U.S. intelligence analyst in Saigon during the Vietnam War, Chuck Searcy never thought that 50 years later he would be living in Communist Vietnam and helping its people fight a different war against unexploded mines.
articles.title: From bombs to Starbucks, US veteran remembers end of Vietnam War 50 years on

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's overnight drone attack killed a 12-year-old girl in the Dnipropetrovsk region and injured her parents, Ukraine's emergency service said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Russia's drone attack kills 12-year-old girl in Dnipropetrovsk region, Ukraine says

articles.author: Jessie Pang, Anne Marie Roantree
articles.description: The first batch of individuals jailed in the landmark Hong Kong national security trial of "47 democrats" accused of conspiracy to commit subversion was freed on Tuesday after being behind bars for over four years.
articles.title: First batch of Hong Kong democrats freed after 4 years' jail for subversion
